member.name: T:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel
member.summary: Ported Cassandra Consistency level for commands over the conection. By convention this values must match Cassandra Consistency Level

member.name: F:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel.ZERO
member.summary: Write: Ensure nothing Read: Not supported, because it doesn't make sense.

member.name: F:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel.ONE
member.summary: Write: Ensure that the write has been written to at least 1 node, including hinted recipients Read: Will return the record returned by the first node to respond. A consistency check is always done in a background thread to fix any consistency issues when ConsistencyLevel.ONE is used. This means subsequent calls will have correct data even if the initial read gets an older value. (This is called read repair.)

member.name: F:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel.QUORUM
member.summary: Write: Ensure that the write has been written to at least 1 node's commit log and memory table before responding to the client. Read: Will query all nodes and return the record with the most recent timestamp once it has at least a majority of replicas reported. Again, the remaining replicas will be checked in the background.

member.name: F:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel.DCQUORUM
member.summary: undocumented

member.name: F:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel.DCQUORUMSYNC
member.summary: undocumented

member.name: F:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel.ALL
member.summary: Write: Ensure that the write is written to all ReplicationFactor nodes before responding to the client. Any unresponsive nodes will fail the operation Read: Will query all nodes and return the record with the most recent timestamp once all nodes have replied. Any unresponsive nodes will fail the operation

member.name: F:Aquiles.Command.AquilesConsistencyLevel.ANY
member.summary: Write: Ensure that the write has been written to at least 1 node, including hinted recipients. Read: Not supported. You probably want ONE instead.

member.name: T:Aquiles.IAquilesConnection
member.summary: Interface for any AquilesConnection with minimum methods to operate with.

member.name: M:Aquiles.IAquilesConnection.Open
member.summary: Retrieves an opened connection from the cluster's pool. When calling this method explicity, automatic command retry is not posible. Using this methods delegates the close responsability to the client using the conection.

member.name: M:Aquiles.IAquilesConnection.Close
member.summary: Release or invalidate (depends on the status of the connection) the opened connection to the cluster's pool. When calling tihs method explicity, a previous open method must be called from client code.

member.name: M:Aquiles.IAquilesConnection.Execute(Aquiles.IAquilesCommand)
member.summary: Execute the over the connection. Throws in case there is some malformed or missing input parameters It validates the command before proceeding, so it might throw if there are malformed or missing input params.
member.param: command to be executed. Must implement IAquilesCommand

member.name: T:Aquiles.AquilesHelper
member.summary: Static class to use as entrypoint for Aquiles. Responsability: * Manage cluster configuration * Manage connection creation

member.name: M:Aquiles.AquilesHelper.Initialize
member.summary: Read the configuration section, create logger, create clusters can throw in case something went wrong

member.name: M:Aquiles.AquilesHelper.RetrieveConnection(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a connection for cluster associated with the given clusterName. In case there is no cluster configured with the friendly name given, an AquilesException is thrown. can throw in case something went wrong
member.param: friendly names chosen in the configuration section on the .config file
member.returns: it returns a connection to work against the cluster.

member.name: M:Aquiles.AquilesHelper.RetrieveInformation(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve information for cluster associated with the given clusterName. In case there is no cluster configured with the friendly name given, an AquilesException is thrown. can throw in case something went wrong
member.param: friendly names chosen in the configuration section on the .config file
member.returns: it returns a read-only information (you may still change this information, though it will not impact on the engine.

member.name: M:Aquiles.AquilesHelper.#ctor
member.summary: private instance constructor that calls Initialize

member.summary: Read the configuration section, create logger, create clusters can throw in case something went wrong

member.param: friendly names chosen in the configuration section on the .config file
member.returns: it returns a connection to work against the cluster.
